id.desc: Component ID, not specified by default. If specified, it can be used to refer the component in option or API.

name.desc: Series name used for displaying in [tooltip](~tooltip) and filtering with [legend](~legend), or updating data and configuration with `setOption`.

zlevel.desc:
`zlevel` value of all graphical elements in .

`zlevel` is used to make layers with Canvas. Graphical elements with different `zlevel` values will be placed in different Canvases, which is a common optimization technique. We can put those frequently changed elements (like those with animations) to a separate `zlevel`. Notice that too many Canvases will increase memory cost, and should be used carefully on mobile phones to avoid crash.

Canvases with bigger `zlevel` will be placed on Canvases with smaller `zlevel`.

z.desc:
`z` value of all graphical elements in , which controls order of drawing graphical components. Components with smaller `z` values may be overwritten by those with larger `z` values.

`z` has a lower priority to `zlevel`, and will not create new Canvas.

center.desc:
Center position of Sunburst chart, the first of which is the horizontal position, and the second is the vertical position.

Percentage is supported. When set in percentage, the item is relative to the container width, and the second item to the height.

**Example: **
```
// Set to absolute pixel values
center: [400, 300]
// Set to relative percent
center: ['50%', '50%']
```

radius.desc:
Radius of Sunburst chart. Value can be:

+ `number`: Specify outside radius directly.
+ `string`: For example, `'20%'`, means that the outside radius is 20% of the viewport size (the little one between width and height of the chart container).


+ `Array.<number|string>`: The first item specifies the inside radius, and the second item specifies the outside radius. Each item follows the definitions above.

data.value.desc: Value for each item. If contains children, value can be left unset, and sum of children values will be used in this case.

data.link.desc:
Link address that redirects to when this sector is clicked. Only useful when [series-sunburst.nodeClick](~series-treemap.nodeClick) is set to be `'link'`.

See [series-sunburst.data.target](~series-sunburst.data.target).

data.target.desc: Like `target` attribute of HTML `<a>`, which can either be `'blank'` or `'self'`. See [series-sunburst.data.link](~series-sunburst.data.link).

data.label.desc:
`label` 描述了每个扇形块中，文本标签的样式。

**优先级：[series.data.label](~series-sunburst.data.label) > [series.levels.label](~series-sunburst.levels.label) > [series.label](~series-sunburst.label)。**



Text label of , to explain some data information about graphic item like value, name and so on. `label` is placed under `itemStyle` in ECharts 2.x. In ECharts 3, to make the configuration structure flatter, `label`is taken to be at the same level with `itemStyle`, and has `emphasis` as `itemStyle` does.

data.label.align.desc:
Align of text, which can be `'left'`, `'center'`, or `'right'`. Note that `'left'` stands for inner side, and `'right'` stands for outer side.


Same to [label.align](~sunburst.label.align)

data.label.minAngle.desc: If angle of data piece is smaller than this value (in degrees), then text is not displayed. This is used for hiding text for small piece of data.

data.label.position.desc:
Label position.

**Followings are the options: **

+ [x, y]

Use relative percentage, or absolute pixel values to represent position of label relative to top-left corner of bounding box.
For example:
```js
// Absolute pixel values
position: [10, 10],
// Relative percentage
position: ['50%', '50%']
```

+ 'top'
+ 'left'
+ 'right'
+ 'bottom'
+ 'inside'
+ 'insideLeft'
+ 'insideRight'
+ 'insideTop'
+ 'insideBottom'
+ 'insideTopLeft'
+ 'insideBottomLeft'
+ 'insideTopRight'
+ 'insideBottomRight'

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

data.label.distance.desc:
Distance to the host graphic element.


It is valid only when `position` is string value (like `'top'`、`'insideRight'`).

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

data.label.offset.desc: Whether to move text slightly. For example: `[30, 40]` means move `30` horizontally and move `40` vertically.

data.label.color.desc:
text color.




If set as `'inherit'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.

data.label.borderColor.desc:
Border color of the text fragment.




If set as `'inherit'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.

data.label.borderWidth.desc: Border width of the text fragment.

data.label.borderType.desc:
the text fragment border type.



Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`borderDashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```js
{

borderType: [5, 10],

borderDashOffset: 5
}
```

data.label.borderDashOffset.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`borderType`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

data.label.borderRadius.desc: Border radius of the text fragment.

data.label.padding.desc:
Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

data.label.shadowColor.desc: Shadow color of the text block.

data.label.shadowBlur.desc: Show blur of the text block.

data.label.shadowOffsetX.desc: Shadow X offset of the text block.

data.label.shadowOffsetY.desc: Shadow Y offset of the text block.

data.label.textBorderColor.desc:
Storke color of the text.




If set as `'inherit'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.

data.label.textBorderWidth.desc: Storke line width of the text.

data.label.textBorderType.desc:
Stroke line type of the text.


Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`textBorderDashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```js
{

textBorderType: [5, 10],

textBorderDashOffset: 5
}
```

data.label.textBorderDashOffset.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`textBorderType`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

data.label.textShadowColor.desc: Shadow color of the text itself.

data.label.textShadowBlur.desc: Shadow blue of the text itself.

data.label.textShadowOffsetX.desc: Shadow X offset of the text itself.

data.label.textShadowOffsetY.desc: Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

data.label.overflow.desc:
Determine how to display the text when it's overflow. Available when `width` is set.

+ `'truncate'` Truncate the text and trailing with `ellipsis`.
+ `'break'` Break by word
+ `'breakAll'` Break by character.

data.label.ellipsis.desc: Ellipsis to be displayed when `overflow` is set to `truncate`.

data.label.lineOverflow.desc:
Determine how to display the text when it's overflow on height.

+ `'truncate'` Truncate the overflow lines.

data.label.rich.<style_name>.color.desc:
text color.




If set as `'inherit'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.

data.label.rich.<style_name>.borderColor.desc:
Border color of the text fragment.




If set as `'inherit'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.

data.label.rich.<style_name>.borderWidth.desc: Border width of the text fragment.

data.label.rich.<style_name>.borderRadiu.desc: Border radius of the text fragment.

data.label.rich.<style_name>.padding.desc:
Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

data.label.rich.<style_name>.shadowColor.desc: Shadow color of the text block.

data.label.rich.<style_name>.shadowBlur.desc: Show blur of the text block.

data.label.rich.<style_name>.shadowOffse.desc: Shadow X offset of the text block.
Shadow Y offset of the text block.

data.label.rich.<style_name>.width.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

data.label.rich.<style_name>.height.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

data.label.rich.<style_name>.textBorderC.desc:
Storke color of the text.




If set as `'inherit'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.

data.label.rich.<style_name>.textBorderW.desc: Storke line width of the text.

data.label.rich.<style_name>.textBorderT.desc:

Possible values are:

+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With

data.labelLine.show.desc: Whether to show the label guide line.

data.labelLine.showAbove.desc: Whether to show the label guide line above the corresponding element.

data.labelLine.length2.desc: The length of the second segment of guide line.

data.labelLine.smooth.desc: Whether to smooth the guide line. It defaults to be `false` and can be set as `true` or the values from 0 to 1 which indicating the smoothness.

data.labelLine.minTurnAngle.desc:
Minimum turn angle between two segments of guide line to prevent unaesthetic display when angle is too small.

Can be 0 - 180 degree.

data.labelLine.lineStyle.color.desc:
Line color.





> Supports setting as solid color using `rgb(255,255,255)`, `rgba(255,255,255,1)`, `#fff`, etc. Also supports setting as gradient color and pattern fill, see [option.color](~color) for details

data.labelLine.lineStyle.type.desc:
line type.


Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`dashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```js
{

type: [5, 10],

dashOffset: 5
}
```

data.labelLine.lineStyle.dashOffset.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`type`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

data.labelLine.lineStyle.cap.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To specify how to draw the end points of the line.
Possible values are:
+ `'butt'`: The ends of lines are squared off at the endpoints.
+ `'round'`: The ends of lines are rounded.
+ `'square'`: The ends of lines are squared off by adding a box with an equal width and half the height of the line's thickness.

Default value is `'butt'`. Refer to MDN [lineCap](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineCap) for more details.

data.labelLine.lineStyle.join.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To determine the shape used to join two line segments where they meet.

Possible values are:
+ `'bevel'`: Fills an additional triangular area between the common endpoint of connected segments, and the separate outside rectangular corners of each segment.
+ `'round'`: Rounds off the corners of a shape by filling an additional sector of disc centered at the common endpoint of connected segments. The radius for these rounded corners is equal to the line width.
+ `'miter'`: Connected segments are joined by extending their outside edges to connect at a single point, with the effect of filling an additional lozenge-shaped area. This setting is affected by the
`miterLimit`
property.

Default value is `'bevel'`. Refer to MDN [lineJoin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineJoin) for more details.

data.labelLine.lineStyle.miterLimit.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the miter limit ratio. Only works when
`join`
is set as `miter`.

Default value is `10`. Negative、`0`、`Infinity` and `NaN` values are ignored.

Refer to MDN [miterLimit](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/miterLimit) for more details.

data.labelLine.lineStyle.shadowBlur.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

data.labelLine.lineStyle.shadowColor.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

data.labelLine.lineStyle.shadowOffsetX.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

data.labelLine.lineStyle.shadowOffsetY.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

data.labelLine.lineStyle.opacity.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

data.itemStyle.desc:
旭日图扇形块的样式。

可以在 [series.itemStyle](~series-sunburst.itemStyle) 定义所有扇形块的样式，也可以在 [series.levels.itemStyle](~series-sunburst.levels.itemStyle) 定义每一层扇形块的样式，还可以在 [series.data.itemStyle](~series-sunburst.data.itemStyle) 定义每个扇形块单独的样式，这三者的优先级从低到高。也就是说，如果定义了 [series.data.itemStyle](~series-sunburst.data.itemStyle)，将会覆盖 [series.itemStyle](~series-sunburst.itemStyle) 和 [series.levels.itemStyle](~series-sunburst.levels.itemStyle)。

**优先级：[series.data.itemStyle](~series-sunburst.data.itemStyle) > [series.levels.itemStyle](~series-sunburst.levels.itemStyle) > [series.itemStyle](~series-sunburst.itemStyle)。**

data.itemStyle.color.desc:
color. Color is taken from [option.color Palette](~color) by default. Since 5.2.0, it can be set to `'inherit'` in the `emphasis` state to disable color highlight.



> Supports setting as solid color using `rgb(255,255,255)`, `rgba(255,255,255,1)`, `#fff`, etc. Also supports setting as gradient color and pattern fill, see [option.color](~color) for details

data.itemStyle.borderColor.desc: border color, whose format is similar to that of `color`.

data.itemStyle.borderWidth.desc:
border width. No border when it is set to be 0.

(${name} ? ${name} : "") + " border width. No border when it is set to be 0."

data.itemStyle.borderType.desc:
border type.



Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`borderDashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```js
{

borderType: [5, 10],

borderDashOffset: 5
}
```

data.itemStyle.borderDashOffset.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`borderType`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

data.itemStyle.borderCap.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To specify how to draw the end points of the line.
Possible values are:
+ `'butt'`: The ends of lines are squared off at the endpoints.
+ `'round'`: The ends of lines are rounded.
+ `'square'`: The ends of lines are squared off by adding a box with an equal width and half the height of the line's thickness.

Default value is `'butt'`. Refer to MDN [lineCap](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineCap) for more details.

data.itemStyle.borderJoin.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To determine the shape used to join two line segments where they meet.

Possible values are:
+ `'bevel'`: Fills an additional triangular area between the common endpoint of connected segments, and the separate outside rectangular corners of each segment.
+ `'round'`: Rounds off the corners of a shape by filling an additional sector of disc centered at the common endpoint of connected segments. The radius for these rounded corners is equal to the line width.
+ `'miter'`: Connected segments are joined by extending their outside edges to connect at a single point, with the effect of filling an additional lozenge-shaped area. This setting is affected by the
`borderMiterLimit`
property.

Default value is `'bevel'`. Refer to MDN [lineJoin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineJoin) for more details.

data.itemStyle.borderMiterLimit.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the miter limit ratio. Only works when
`borderJoin`
is set as `miter`.

Default value is `10`. Negative、`0`、`Infinity` and `NaN` values are ignored.

Refer to MDN [miterLimit](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/miterLimit) for more details.

data.itemStyle.shadowBlur.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
```

data.itemStyle.shadowColor.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

data.itemStyle.shadowOffsetX.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

data.itemStyle.shadowOffsetY.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

data.itemStyle.opacity.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

data.itemStyle.decal.desc:
The style of the decal pattern. It works only if [aria.enabled](~aria.enabled) and [aria.decal.show](~aria.decal.show) are both set to be `true`.

If it is set to be `'none'`, no decal will be used.

data.itemStyle.decal.symbol.desc:
The symbol type of the decal. If it is in the type of `string[]`, it means the symbols are used one by one.



Icon types provided by ECharts includes



`'circle'`, `'rect'`, `'roundRect'`, `'triangle'`, `'diamond'`, `'pin'`, `'arrow'`, `'none'`







It can be set to an image with `'image://url'` , in which URL is the link to an image, or `dataURI` of an image.


An image URL example:

```
'image://http://xxx.xxx.xxx/a/b.png'
```

A `dataURI` example:

```
'image://data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAQAMQAAORHHOVSKudfOulrSOp3WOyDZu6QdvCchPGolfO0o/XBs/fNwfjZ0frl3/zy7////wAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACH5BAkAABAALAAAAAAQABAAAAVVICSOZGlCQAosJ6mu7fiyZeKqNKToQGDsM8hBADgUXoGAiqhSvp5QAnQKGIgUhwFUYLCVDFCrKUE1lBavAViFIDlTImbKC5Gm2hB0SlBCBMQiB0UjIQA7'
```



Icons can be set to arbitrary vector path via `'path://'` in ECharts. As compared with a raster image, vector paths prevent jagging and blurring when scaled, and have better control over changing colors. The size of the vector icon will be adapted automatically. Refer to [SVG PathData](http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/paths.html#PathData) for more information about the format of the path. You may export vector paths from tools like Adobe

For example:

```
'path://M30.9,53.2C16.8,53.2,5.3,41.7,5.3,27.6S16.8,2,30.9,2C45,2,56.4,13.5,56.4,27.6S45,53.2,30.9,53.2z M30.9,3.5C17.6,3.5,6.8,14.4,6.8,27.6c0,13.3,10.8,24.1,24.101,24.1C44.2,51.7,55,40.9,55,27.6C54.9,14.4,44.1,3.5,30.9,3.5z M36.9,35.8c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H36c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1V35.8z M27.8,35.8 c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H27c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1L27.8,35.8L27.8,35.8z'
```

data.itemStyle.decal.symbolSize.desc: Range of values: `0` to `1`, representing the size of symbol relative to decal.

data.itemStyle.decal.symbolKeepAspect.desc: Whether or not to keep the aspect ratio of the pattern.

data.itemStyle.decal.color.desc: For the color of the decal pattern, it is recommended to use a translucent color, which can be superimposed on the color of the series itself.

data.itemStyle.decal.backgroundColor.desc: The background color of the decal will be over the color of the series itself, under the decal pattern.

data.itemStyle.decal.dashArrayX.desc:
The basic pattern of the decal pattern is an infinite loop in the form of `Pattern - Blank - Pattern - Blank - Pattern - Blank` both horizontally and vertically, respectively. By setting the length of each pattern and blank, complex pattern effects can be achieved.

`dashArrayX` controls the horizontal pattern pattern. When its value is of type `number` or `number[]`, it is similar to [SVG stroke-dasharray](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray).

- If it is of type `number`, it means that the pattern and the blank space are of this value respectively. For example, `5` means the pattern with width 5 is displayed first, then 5 pixels empty, then the pattern with width 5 is displayed...

- In the case of `number[]` type, it means that the pattern and empty space are loops of an array of values. For example: `[5, 10, 2, 6]` means the pattern is 5 pixels wide, then 10 pixels empty, then the pattern is 2 pixels wide, then 6 pixels empty, then the pattern is 5 pixels wide...

- If of type `(number | number[])[]`, it means that each row is a loop with an array of values for the pattern and blank space. For example: `[10, [2, 5]]` means that the first line will be 10 pixels by 10 pixels and empty space, the second line will be 2 pixels by 2 pixels and empty space, and the third line will be 10 pixels by 10 pixels and empty space...

This interface can be better understood with the following examples.

~[700x300](doc-example/aria-decal&edit=1&reset=1)

data.itemStyle.decal.dashArrayY.desc:
The basic pattern of the decal pattern is an infinite loop in the form of `Pattern - Blank - Pattern - Blank - Pattern - Blank` both horizontally and vertically, respectively. By setting the length of each pattern and blank, complex pattern effects can be achieved.

`dashArrayY` controls the horizontal pattern pattern. Similar to [SVG stroke-dasharray](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray).

- If it is a `number` type, it means the pattern and the blank are each of this value. For example, `5` means that the pattern with a height of 5 is displayed first, then 5 pixels empty, then the pattern with a height of 5 is displayed...

- In the case of `number[]` type, it means that the pattern and empty space are loops of sequential array values. For example: `[5, 10, 2, 6]` means the pattern is 5 pixels high, then 10 pixels empty, then the pattern is 2 pixels high, then 6 pixels empty, then the pattern is 5 pixels high...

This interface can be better understood with the following examples.

~[700x300](doc-example/aria-decal&edit=1&reset=1)

data.itemStyle.decal.rotation.desc: The overall rotation angle (in radians) of the pattern, in the range from `-Math.

data.itemStyle.decal.maxTileWidth.desc: The upper limit of the width of the generated pattern before it is duplicated. Usually this value is not necessary, but you can try to increase it if you notice discontinuous seams in the pattern when it repeats.

data.itemStyle.decal.maxTileHeight.desc: The upper limit of the height of the generated pattern before it repeats. This value is usually not necessary to set, but you can try to increase it if you find that the pattern has discontinuous seams when it is repeated.

label.desc:
`label` 描述了每个扇形块中，文本标签的样式。

**优先级：[series.data.label](~series-sunburst.data.label) > [series.levels.label](~series-sunburst.levels.label) > [series.label](~series-sunburst.label)。**



Text label of , to explain some data information about graphic item like value, name and so on. `label` is placed under `itemStyle` in ECharts 2.x. In ECharts 3, to make the configuration structure flatter, `label`is taken to be at the same level with `itemStyle`, and has `emphasis` as `itemStyle` does.

label.rotate.desc:
If it is `number` type, then is stands for rotation, from -90 degrees to 90 degrees, and positive values stand for counterclockwise.

Besides, it can be string `'radial'`, standing for radial rotation; or `'tangential'`, standing for tangential rotation.

By default, it is `'radial'`. If no rotation is wanted, it can be set to `0`.

The following example shows different `rotate` settings:

~[700x400](sunburst-label-rotate&edit=1&reset=1)

Same to [label.rotate](~sunburst.label.rotate)

label.align.desc:
Align of text, which can be `'left'`, `'center'`, or `'right'`. Note that `'left'` stands for inner side, and `'right'` stands for outer side.


~[700x400](doc-example/sunburst-label-align&edit=1&reset=1)

label.minAngle.desc: If angle of data piece is smaller than this value (in degrees), then text is not displayed. This is used for hiding text for small piece of data.

label.position.desc:
Label position.

**Followings are the options: **

+ [x, y]

Use relative percentage, or absolute pixel values to represent position of label relative to top-left corner of bounding box.
For example:
```js
// Absolute pixel values
position: [10, 10],
// Relative percentage
position: ['50%', '50%']
```

+ 'top'
+ 'left'
+ 'right'
+ 'bottom'
+ 'inside'
+ 'insideLeft'
+ 'insideRight'
+ 'insideTop'
+ 'insideBottom'
+ 'insideTopLeft'
+ 'insideBottomLeft'
+ 'insideTopRight'
+ 'insideBottomRight'

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

label.distance.desc:
Distance to the host graphic element.


It is valid only when `position` is string value (like `'top'`、`'insideRight'`).

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

label.offset.desc: Whether to move text slightly. For example: `[30, 40]` means move `30` horizontally and move `40` vertically.

label.color.desc:
text color.




If set as `'inherit'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.

label.borderColor.desc:
Border color of the text fragment.




If set as `'inherit'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.

label.borderWidth.desc: Border width of the text fragment.

label.borderType.desc:
the text fragment border type.



Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`borderDashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```js
{

borderType: [5, 10],

borderDashOffset: 5
}
```

label.borderDashOffset.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`borderType`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

label.borderRadius.desc: Border radius of the text fragment.

label.padding.desc:
Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

label.shadowColor.desc: Shadow color of the text block.

label.shadowBlur.desc: Show blur of the text block.

label.shadowOffsetX.desc: Shadow X offset of the text block.

label.shadowOffsetY.desc: Shadow Y offset of the text block.

label.textBorderColor.desc:
Storke color of the text.




If set as `'inherit'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.

label.textBorderWidth.desc: Storke line width of the text.

label.textBorderType.desc:

Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With

label.textShadowColor.desc: Shadow color of the text itself.

label.textShadowBlur.desc: Shadow blue of the text itself.

label.textShadowOffsetX.desc: Shadow X offset of the text itself.

label.textShadowOffsetY.desc: Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

label.overflow.desc:
Determine how to display the text when it's overflow. Available when `width` is set.

+ `'truncate'` Truncate the text and trailing with `ellipsis`.
+ `'break'` Break by word
+ `'breakAll'` Break by character.

label.ellipsis.desc: Ellipsis to be displayed when `overflow` is set to `truncate`.

label.lineOverflow.desc:
Determine how to display the text when it's overflow on height.

+ `'truncate'` Truncate the overflow lines.

label.rich.<style_name>.width.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

labelLine.show.desc: Whether to show the label guide line.

labelLine.showAbove.desc: Whether to show the label guide line above the corresponding element.

labelLine.length2.desc: The length of the second segment of guide line.

labelLine.smooth.desc: Whether to smooth the guide line. It defaults to be `false` and can be set as `true` or the values from 0 to 1 which indicating the smoothness.

labelLine.minTurnAngle.desc:
Minimum turn angle between two segments of guide line to prevent unaesthetic display when angle is too small.

Can be 0 - 180 degree.

labelLine.lineStyle.color.desc:
Line color.





> Supports setting as solid color using `rgb(255,255,255)`, `rgba(255,255,255,1)`, `#fff`, etc. Also supports setting as gradient color and pattern fill, see [option.color](~color) for details

labelLine.lineStyle.type.desc:
line type.


Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`dashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```js
{

type: [5, 10],

dashOffset: 5
}
```

labelLine.lineStyle.dashOffset.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`type`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

labelLine.lineStyle.cap.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To specify how to draw the end points of the line.
Possible values are:
+ `'butt'`: The ends of lines are squared off at the endpoints.
+ `'round'`: The ends of lines are rounded.
+ `'square'`: The ends of lines are squared off by adding a box with an equal width and half the height of the line's thickness.

Default value is `'butt'`. Refer to MDN [lineCap](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineCap) for more details.

labelLine.lineStyle.join.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To determine the shape used to join two line segments where they meet.

Possible values are:
+ `'bevel'`: Fills an additional triangular area between the common endpoint of connected segments, and the separate outside rectangular corners of each segment.
+ `'round'`: Rounds off the corners of a shape by filling an additional sector of disc centered at the common endpoint of connected segments. The radius for these rounded corners is equal to the line width.
+ `'miter'`: Connected segments are joined by extending their outside edges to connect at a single point, with the effect of filling an additional lozenge-shaped area. This setting is affected by the
`miterLimit`
property.

Default value is `'bevel'`. Refer to MDN [lineJoin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineJoin) for more details.

labelLine.lineStyle.miterLimit.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the miter limit ratio. Only works when
`join`
is set as `miter`.

Default value is `10`. Negative、`0`、`Infinity` and `NaN` values are ignored.

Refer to MDN [miterLimit](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/miterLimit) for more details.

labelLine.lineStyle.shadowBlur.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

labelLine.lineStyle.shadowColor.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

labelLine.lineStyle.shadowOffsetX.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

labelLine.lineStyle.shadowOffsetY.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

labelLine.lineStyle.opacity.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

itemStyle.desc:
旭日图扇形块的样式。

可以在 [series.itemStyle](~series-sunburst.itemStyle) 定义所有扇形块的样式，也可以在 [series.levels.itemStyle](~series-sunburst.levels.itemStyle) 定义每一层扇形块的样式，还可以在 [series.data.itemStyle](~series-sunburst.data.itemStyle) 定义每个扇形块单独的样式，这三者的优先级从低到高。也就是说，如果定义了 [series.data.itemStyle](~series-sunburst.data.itemStyle)，将会覆盖 [series.itemStyle](~series-sunburst.itemStyle) 和 [series.levels.itemStyle](~series-sunburst.levels.itemStyle)。

**优先级：[series.data.itemStyle](~series-sunburst.data.itemStyle) > [series.levels.itemStyle](~series-sunburst.levels.itemStyle) > [series.itemStyle](~series-sunburst.itemStyle)。**

color. Color is taken from [option.color Palette](~color) by default. Since 5.2.0, it can be set to `'inherit'` in the `emphasis` state to disable color highlight.



> Supports setting as solid color using `rgb(255,255,255)`, `rgba(255,255,255,1)`, `#fff`, etc. Also supports setting as gradient color and pattern fill, see [option.color](~color) for details

`borderDashOffset`

For example：
```js

borderType: [5, 10],

}
```

`borderType`

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

itemStyle.borderCap.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To specify how to draw the end points of the line.
Possible values are:
+ `'butt'`: The ends of lines are squared off at the endpoints.
+ `'round'`: The ends of lines are rounded.
+ `'square'`: The ends of lines are squared off by adding a box with an equal width and half the height of the line's thickness.

Default value is `'butt'`. Refer to MDN [lineCap](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineCap) for more details.

itemStyle.borderJoin.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To determine the shape used to join two line segments where they meet.

Possible values are:
+ `'bevel'`: Fills an additional triangular area between the common endpoint of connected segments, and the separate outside rectangular corners of each segment.
+ `'round'`: Rounds off the corners of a shape by filling an additional sector of disc centered at the common endpoint of connected segments. The radius for these rounded corners is equal to the line width.
+ `'miter'`: Connected segments are joined by extending their outside edges to connect at a single point, with the effect of filling an additional lozenge-shaped area. This setting is affected by the
`borderMiterLimit`
property.

Default value is `'bevel'`. Refer to MDN [lineJoin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineJoin) for more details.

itemStyle.borderMiterLimit.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the miter limit ratio. Only works when
`borderJoin`
is set as `miter`.

Default value is `10`. Negative、`0`、`Infinity` and `NaN` values are ignored.

Refer to MDN [miterLimit](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/miterLimit) for more details.

Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:

itemStyle.shadowOffsetY.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

itemStyle.opacity.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

itemStyle.decal.desc:
The style of the decal pattern. It works only if [aria.enabled](~aria.enabled) and [aria.decal.show](~aria.decal.show) are both set to be `true`.

If it is set to be `'none'`, no decal will be used.

itemStyle.decal.symbol.desc:
The symbol type of the decal. If it is in the type of `string[]`, it means the symbols are used one by one.



Icon types provided by ECharts includes



`'circle'`, `'rect'`, `'roundRect'`, `'triangle'`, `'diamond'`, `'pin'`, `'arrow'`, `'none'`







It can be set to an image with `'image://url'` , in which URL is the link to an image, or `dataURI` of an image.


An image URL example:

```
'image://http://xxx.xxx.xxx/a/b.png'
```

A `dataURI` example:

```
'image://data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAQAMQAAORHHOVSKudfOulrSOp3WOyDZu6QdvCchPGolfO0o/XBs/fNwfjZ0frl3/zy7////wAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACH5BAkAABAALAAAAAAQABAAAAVVICSOZGlCQAosJ6mu7fiyZeKqNKToQGDsM8hBADgUXoGAiqhSvp5QAnQKGIgUhwFUYLCVDFCrKUE1lBavAViFIDlTImbKC5Gm2hB0SlBCBMQiB0UjIQA7'
```



Icons can be set to arbitrary vector path via `'path://'` in ECharts. As compared with a raster image, vector paths prevent jagging and blurring when scaled, and have better control over changing colors. The size of the vector icon will be adapted automatically. Refer to [SVG PathData](http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/paths.html#PathData) for more information about the format of the path. You may export vector paths from tools like Adobe

For example:

```
'path://M30.9,53.2C16.8,53.2,5.3,41.7,5.3,27.6S16.8,2,30.9,2C45,2,56.4,13.5,56.4,27.6S45,53.2,30.9,53.2z M30.9,3.5C17.6,3.5,6.8,14.4,6.8,27.6c0,13.3,10.8,24.1,24.101,24.1C44.2,51.7,55,40.9,55,27.6C54.9,14.4,44.1,3.5,30.9,3.5z M36.9,35.8c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H36c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1V35.8z M27.8,35.8 c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H27c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1L27.8,35.8L27.8,35.8z'
```

itemStyle.decal.symbolSize.desc: Range of values: `0` to `1`, representing the size of symbol relative to decal.

itemStyle.decal.symbolKeepAspect.desc: Whether or not to keep the aspect ratio of the pattern.

itemStyle.decal.color.desc: For the color of the decal pattern, it is recommended to use a translucent color, which can be superimposed on the color of the series itself.

itemStyle.decal.backgroundColor.desc: The background color of the decal will be over the color of the series itself, under the decal pattern.

itemStyle.decal.dashArrayX.desc:
The basic pattern of the decal pattern is an infinite loop in the form of `Pattern - Blank - Pattern - Blank - Pattern - Blank` both horizontally and vertically, respectively. By setting the length of each pattern and blank, complex pattern effects can be achieved.

`dashArrayX` controls the horizontal pattern pattern. When its value is of type `number` or `number[]`, it is similar to [SVG stroke-dasharray](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray).

- If it is of type `number`, it means that the pattern and the blank space are of this value respectively. For example, `5` means the pattern with width 5 is displayed first, then 5 pixels empty, then the pattern with width 5 is displayed...

- In the case of `number[]` type, it means that the pattern and empty space are loops of an array of values. For example: `[5, 10, 2, 6]` means the pattern is 5 pixels wide, then 10 pixels empty, then the pattern is 2 pixels wide, then 6 pixels empty, then the pattern is 5 pixels wide...

- If of type `(number | number[])[]`, it means that each row is a loop with an array of values for the pattern and blank space. For example: `[10, [2, 5]]` means that the first line will be 10 pixels by 10 pixels and empty space, the second line will be 2 pixels by 2 pixels and empty space, and the third line will be 10 pixels by 10 pixels and empty space...

This interface can be better understood with the following examples.

~[700x300](doc-example/aria-decal&edit=1&reset=1)

itemStyle.decal.dashArrayY.desc:
The basic pattern of the decal pattern is an infinite loop in the form of `Pattern - Blank - Pattern - Blank - Pattern - Blank` both horizontally and vertically, respectively. By setting the length of each pattern and blank, complex pattern effects can be achieved.

`dashArrayY` controls the horizontal pattern pattern. Similar to [SVG stroke-dasharray](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray).

- If it is a `number` type, it means the pattern and the blank are each of this value. For example, `5` means that the pattern with a height of 5 is displayed first, then 5 pixels empty, then the pattern with a height of 5 is displayed...

- In the case of `number[]` type, it means that the pattern and empty space are loops of sequential array values. For example: `[5, 10, 2, 6]` means the pattern is 5 pixels high, then 10 pixels empty, then the pattern is 2 pixels high, then 6 pixels empty, then the pattern is 5 pixels high...

This interface can be better understood with the following examples.

~[700x300](doc-example/aria-decal&edit=1&reset=1)

itemStyle.decal.rotation.desc: The overall rotation angle (in radians) of the pattern, in the range from `-Math.

itemStyle.decal.maxTileWidth.desc: The upper limit of the width of the generated pattern before it is duplicated. Usually this value is not necessary, but you can try to increase it if you notice discontinuous seams in the pattern when it repeats.

itemStyle.decal.maxTileHeight.desc:
The upper limit of the height of the generated pattern before it repeats. This value is usually not necessary to set, but you can try to increase it if you find that the pattern has discontinuous seams when it is repeated.










## emphasis

Configurations of emphasis state.

itemStyle.decal.label.desc:
`label` 描述了每个扇形块中，文本标签的样式。

**优先级：[series.data.label](~series-sunburst.data.label) > [series.levels.label](~series-sunburst.levels.label) > [series.label](~series-sunburst.label)。**



Text label of , to explain some data information about graphic item like value, name and so on. `label` is placed under `itemStyle` in ECharts 2.x. In ECharts 3, to make the configuration structure flatter, `label`is taken to be at the same level with `itemStyle`, and has `emphasis` as `itemStyle` does.

itemStyle.decal.label.align.desc:
Align of text, which can be `'left'`, `'center'`, or `'right'`. Note that `'left'` stands for inner side, and `'right'` stands for outer side.


Same to [label.align](~sunburst.label.align)

itemStyle.decal.label.minAngle.desc: If angle of data piece is smaller than this value (in degrees), then text is not displayed. This is used for hiding text for small piece of data.

itemStyle.decal.label.position.desc:
Label position.

**Followings are the options: **

+ [x, y]

Use relative percentage, or absolute pixel values to represent position of label relative to top-left corner of bounding box.
For example:
```js
// Absolute pixel values
position: [10, 10],
// Relative percentage
position: ['50%', '50%']
```

+ 'top'
+ 'left'
+ 'right'
+ 'bottom'
+ 'inside'
+ 'insideLeft'
+ 'insideRight'
+ 'insideTop'
+ 'insideBottom'
+ 'insideTopLeft'
+ 'insideBottomLeft'
+ 'insideTopRight'
+ 'insideBottomRight'

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

itemStyle.decal.label.distance.desc:
Distance to the host graphic element.


It is valid only when `position` is string value (like `'top'`、`'insideRight'`).

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

itemStyle.decal.label.offset.desc: Whether to move text slightly. For example: `[30, 40]` means move `30` horizontally and move `40` vertically.

itemStyle.decal.label.color.desc:
text color.




If set as `'inherit'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.

itemStyle.decal.label.borderColor.desc:
Border color of the text fragment.




If set as `'inherit'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.

itemStyle.decal.label.borderWidth.desc: Border width of the text fragment.

itemStyle.decal.label.borderType.desc:
the text fragment border type.



Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`borderDashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```js
{

borderType: [5, 10],

borderDashOffset: 5
}
```

itemStyle.decal.label.borderDashOffset.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`borderType`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

itemStyle.decal.label.borderRadius.desc: Border radius of the text fragment.

itemStyle.decal.label.padding.desc:
Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

itemStyle.decal.label.overflow.desc:
Determine how to display the text when it's overflow. Available when `width` is set.

+ `'truncate'` Truncate the text and trailing with `ellipsis`.
+ `'break'` Break by word
+ `'breakAll'` Break by character.

itemStyle.decal.label.ellipsis.desc: Ellipsis to be displayed when `overflow` is set to `truncate`.

itemStyle.decal.label.lineOverflow.desc:

+ `'truncate'` Truncate the overflow lines.

itemStyle.decal.labelLine.show.desc: Whether to show the label guide line.

itemStyle.decal.labelLine.showAbove.desc: Whether to show the label guide line above the corresponding element.

itemStyle.decal.labelLine.length2.desc: The length of the second segment of guide line.

itemStyle.decal.labelLine.smooth.desc: Whether to smooth the guide line. It defaults to be `false` and can be set as `true` or the values from 0 to 1 which indicating the smoothness.

itemStyle.decal.labelLine.minTurnAngle.desc:
Minimum turn angle between two segments of guide line to prevent unaesthetic display when angle is too small.

Can be 0 - 180 degree.

itemStyle.decal.labelLine.lineStyle.colo.desc:
Line color.





> Supports setting as solid color using `rgb(255,255,255)`, `rgba(255,255,255,1)`, `#fff`, etc. Also supports setting as gradient color and pattern fill, see [option.color](~color) for details

itemStyle.decal.labelLine.lineStyle.type.desc:
line type.


Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`dashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```js
{

type: [5, 10],

dashOffset: 5
}
```

itemStyle.decal.labelLine.lineStyle.dash.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`type`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

itemStyle.decal.labelLine.lineStyle.cap.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To specify how to draw the end points of the line.
Possible values are:
+ `'butt'`: The ends of lines are squared off at the endpoints.
+ `'round'`: The ends of lines are rounded.
+ `'square'`: The ends of lines are squared off by adding a box with an equal width and half the height of the line's thickness.

Default value is `'butt'`. Refer to MDN [lineCap](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineCap) for more details.

itemStyle.decal.labelLine.lineStyle.join.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To determine the shape used to join two line segments where they meet.

Possible values are:
+ `'bevel'`: Fills an additional triangular area between the common endpoint of connected segments, and the separate outside rectangular corners of each segment.
+ `'round'`: Rounds off the corners of a shape by filling an additional sector of disc centered at the common endpoint of connected segments. The radius for these rounded corners is equal to the line width.
+ `'miter'`: Connected segments are joined by extending their outside edges to connect at a single point, with the effect of filling an additional lozenge-shaped area. This setting is affected by the
`miterLimit`
property.

Default value is `'bevel'`. Refer to MDN [lineJoin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineJoin) for more details.

itemStyle.decal.labelLine.lineStyle.mite.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the miter limit ratio. Only works when
`join`
is set as `miter`.

Default value is `10`. Negative、`0`、`Infinity` and `NaN` values are ignored.

Refer to MDN [miterLimit](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/miterLimit) for more details.

itemStyle.decal.labelLine.lineStyle.shad.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```
Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.
Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.
Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

itemStyle.decal.labelLine.lineStyle.opac.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

itemStyle.decal.itemStyle.desc:

**优先级：[series.data.itemStyle](~series-sunburst.data.itemStyle) > [series.levels.itemStyle](~series-sunburst.levels.itemStyle) > [series.itemStyle](~series-sunburst.itemStyle)。**

+ `'round'`: Rounds off the corners of a shape by filling an additional sector of disc centered at the common endpoint of connected segments. The radius for these rounded corners is equal to the line width.

itemStyle.decal.itemStyle.decal.desc:
The style of the decal pattern. It works only if [aria.enabled](~aria.enabled) and [aria.decal.show](~aria.decal.show) are both set to be `true`.

If it is set to be `'none'`, no decal will be used.

itemStyle.decal.itemStyle.decal.symbol.desc:
The symbol type of the decal. If it is in the type of `string[]`, it means the symbols are used one by one.



Icon types provided by ECharts includes



`'circle'`, `'rect'`, `'roundRect'`, `'triangle'`, `'diamond'`, `'pin'`, `'arrow'`, `'none'`







It can be set to an image with `'image://url'` , in which URL is the link to an image, or `dataURI` of an image.


An image URL example:

```
'image://http://xxx.xxx.xxx/a/b.png'
```

A `dataURI` example:

```
'image://data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAQAMQAAORHHOVSKudfOulrSOp3WOyDZu6QdvCchPGolfO0o/XBs/fNwfjZ0frl3/zy7////wAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACH5BAkAABAALAAAAAAQABAAAAVVICSOZGlCQAosJ6mu7fiyZeKqNKToQGDsM8hBADgUXoGAiqhSvp5QAnQKGIgUhwFUYLCVDFCrKUE1lBavAViFIDlTImbKC5Gm2hB0SlBCBMQiB0UjIQA7'
```



Icons can be set to arbitrary vector path via `'path://'` in ECharts. As compared with a raster image, vector paths prevent jagging and blurring when scaled, and have better control over changing colors. The size of the vector icon will be adapted automatically. Refer to [SVG PathData](http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/paths.html#PathData) for more information about the format of the path. You may export vector paths from tools like Adobe

For example:

```
'path://M30.9,53.2C16.8,53.2,5.3,41.7,5.3,27.6S16.8,2,30.9,2C45,2,56.4,13.5,56.4,27.6S45,53.2,30.9,53.2z M30.9,3.5C17.6,3.5,6.8,14.4,6.8,27.6c0,13.3,10.8,24.1,24.101,24.1C44.2,51.7,55,40.9,55,27.6C54.9,14.4,44.1,3.5,30.9,3.5z M36.9,35.8c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H36c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1V35.8z M27.8,35.8 c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H27c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1L27.8,35.8L27.8,35.8z'
```

itemStyle.decal.itemStyle.decal.symbolSi.desc: Range of values: `0` to `1`, representing the size of symbol relative to decal.

itemStyle.decal.itemStyle.decal.symbolKe.desc: Whether or not to keep the aspect ratio of the pattern.

itemStyle.decal.itemStyle.decal.color.desc: For the color of the decal pattern, it is recommended to use a translucent color, which can be superimposed on the color of the series itself.

itemStyle.decal.itemStyle.decal.backgrou.desc: The background color of the decal will be over the color of the series itself, under the decal pattern.

itemStyle.decal.itemStyle.decal.dashArra.desc:
The basic pattern of the decal pattern is an infinite loop in the form of `Pattern - Blank - Pattern - Blank - Pattern - Blank` both horizontally and vertically, respectively. By setting the length of each pattern and blank, complex pattern effects can be achieved.

`dashArrayX` controls the horizontal pattern pattern. When its value is of type `number` or `number[]`, it is similar to [SVG stroke-dasharray](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray).

- If it is of type `number`, it means that the pattern and the blank space are of this value respectively. For example, `5` means the pattern with width 5 is displayed first, then 5 pixels empty, then the pattern with width 5 is displayed...

- In the case of `number[]` type, it means that the pattern and empty space are loops of an array of values. For example: `[5, 10, 2, 6]` means the pattern is 5 pixels wide, then 10 pixels empty, then the pattern is 2 pixels wide, then 6 pixels empty, then the pattern is 5 pixels wide...

- If of type `(number | number[])[]`, it means that each row is a loop with an array of values for the pattern and blank space. For example: `[10, [2, 5]]` means that the first line will be 10 pixels by 10 pixels and empty space, the second line will be 2 pixels by 2 pixels and empty space, and the third line will be 10 pixels by 10 pixels and empty space...

This interface can be better understood with the following examples.

~[700x300](doc-example/aria-decal&edit=1&reset=1)

The basic pattern of the decal pattern is an infinite loop in the form of `Pattern - Blank - Pattern - Blank - Pattern - Blank` both horizontally and vertically, respectively. By setting the length of each pattern and blank, complex pattern effects can be achieved.

`dashArrayY` controls the horizontal pattern pattern. Similar to [SVG stroke-dasharray](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray).

- If it is a `number` type, it means the pattern and the blank are each of this value. For example, `5` means that the pattern with a height of 5 is displayed first, then 5 pixels empty, then the pattern with a height of 5 is displayed...

- In the case of `number[]` type, it means that the pattern and empty space are loops of sequential array values. For example: `[5, 10, 2, 6]` means the pattern is 5 pixels high, then 10 pixels empty, then the pattern is 2 pixels high, then 6 pixels empty, then the pattern is 5 pixels high...

This interface can be better understood with the following examples.

~[700x300](doc-example/aria-decal&edit=1&reset=1)

itemStyle.decal.itemStyle.decal.maxTileH.desc: The upper limit of the height of the generated pattern before it repeats. This value is usually not necessary to set, but you can try to increase it if you find that the pattern has discontinuous seams when it is repeated.

renderLabelForZeroData.desc: If there is no `name`, whether need to render it.

itemStyle.focus.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`




When the data is highlighted, whether to fade out of other data to focus the highlighted. The following configurations are supported:

+ `'none'` Do not fade out other data, it's by default.
+ `'self'` Only focus (not fade out) the element of the currently highlighted data.


+ `'series'` Focus on all elements of the series which the currently highlighted data belongs to.



+ `'ancestor'` Focus on all ancestor nodes.
+ `'descendant'` Focus on all descendants nodes.


**Example: **


```js
emphasis: {
focus: 'series',
blurScope: 'coordinateSystem'
}
```

~[600x400](bar-y-category-stack&reset=1&edit=1)

itemStyle.blurScope.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`



The range of fade out when `focus` is enabled. Support the following configurations

+ `'coordinateSystem'`
+ `'series'`
+ `'global'`

itemStyle.label.desc:
`label` 描述了每个扇形块中，文本标签的样式。

**优先级：[series.data.label](~series-sunburst.data.label) > [series.levels.label](~series-sunburst.levels.label) > [series.label](~series-sunburst.label)。**



Text label of , to explain some data information about graphic item like value, name and so on. `label` is placed under `itemStyle` in ECharts 2.x. In ECharts 3, to make the configuration structure flatter, `label`is taken to be at the same level with `itemStyle`, and has `emphasis` as `itemStyle` does.

itemStyle.label.align.desc:
Align of text, which can be `'left'`, `'center'`, or `'right'`. Note that `'left'` stands for inner side, and `'right'` stands for outer side.


Same to [label.align](~sunburst.label.align)

itemStyle.label.minAngle.desc: If angle of data piece is smaller than this value (in degrees), then text is not displayed. This is used for hiding text for small piece of data.

itemStyle.label.position.desc:
Label position.

**Followings are the options: **

+ [x, y]

Use relative percentage, or absolute pixel values to represent position of label relative to top-left corner of bounding box.
For example:
```js
// Absolute pixel values
position: [10, 10],
// Relative percentage
position: ['50%', '50%']
```

+ 'top'
+ 'left'
+ 'right'
+ 'bottom'
+ 'inside'
+ 'insideLeft'
+ 'insideRight'
+ 'insideTop'
+ 'insideBottom'
+ 'insideTopLeft'
+ 'insideBottomLeft'
+ 'insideTopRight'
+ 'insideBottomRight'

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

itemStyle.label.distance.desc:
Distance to the host graphic element.


It is valid only when `position` is string value (like `'top'`、`'insideRight'`).

See: [label position](doc-example/label-position).

itemStyle.label.offset.desc: Whether to move text slightly. For example: `[30, 40]` means move `30` horizontally and move `40` vertically.

itemStyle.label.color.desc:
text color.




If set as `'inherit'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.

itemStyle.label.borderColor.desc:
Border color of the text fragment.




If set as `'inherit'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.

itemStyle.label.borderWidth.desc: Border width of the text fragment.

itemStyle.label.borderType.desc:
the text fragment border type.



Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`borderDashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```js
{

borderType: [5, 10],

borderDashOffset: 5
}
```

itemStyle.label.borderDashOffset.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`borderType`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

itemStyle.label.borderRadius.desc: Border radius of the text fragment.

itemStyle.label.padding.desc:
Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

itemStyle.label.shadowColor.desc: Shadow color of the text block.

itemStyle.label.shadowBlur.desc: Show blur of the text block.

itemStyle.label.shadowOffsetX.desc: Shadow X offset of the text block.

itemStyle.label.shadowOffsetY.desc: Shadow Y offset of the text block.

Storke color of the text.




If set as `'inherit'`, the color will assigned as visual color, such as series color.

itemStyle.label.textBorderWidth.desc: Storke line width of the text.

itemStyle.label.textShadowBlur.desc: Shadow blue of the text itself.

itemStyle.label.textShadowOffsetX.desc: Shadow X offset of the text itself.

itemStyle.label.textShadowOffsetY.desc: Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

itemStyle.label.overflow.desc:
Determine how to display the text when it's overflow. Available when `width` is set.

+ `'truncate'` Truncate the text and trailing with `ellipsis`.
+ `'break'` Break by word
+ `'breakAll'` Break by character.

itemStyle.label.ellipsis.desc: Ellipsis to be displayed when `overflow` is set to `truncate`.

itemStyle.label.lineOverflow.desc:
Determine how to display the text when it's overflow on height.

+ `'truncate'` Truncate the overflow lines.

itemStyle.label.rich.<style_name>.paddin.desc:
Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.

itemStyle.label.rich.<style_name>.shadow.desc: Shadow color of the text block.
Show blur of the text block.
Shadow X offset of the text block.
Shadow Y offset of the text block.

itemStyle.label.rich.<style_name>.width.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

itemStyle.label.rich.<style_name>.height.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

itemStyle.labelLine.show.desc: Whether to show the label guide line.

itemStyle.labelLine.showAbove.desc: Whether to show the label guide line above the corresponding element.

itemStyle.labelLine.length2.desc: The length of the second segment of guide line.

itemStyle.labelLine.smooth.desc: Whether to smooth the guide line. It defaults to be `false` and can be set as `true` or the values from 0 to 1 which indicating the smoothness.

itemStyle.labelLine.minTurnAngle.desc:
Minimum turn angle between two segments of guide line to prevent unaesthetic display when angle is too small.

Can be 0 - 180 degree.

itemStyle.labelLine.lineStyle.color.desc:
Line color.





> Supports setting as solid color using `rgb(255,255,255)`, `rgba(255,255,255,1)`, `#fff`, etc. Also supports setting as gradient color and pattern fill, see [option.color](~color) for details

itemStyle.labelLine.lineStyle.type.desc:
line type.


Possible values are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

Since `v5.0.0`, it can also be a number or a number array to specify the [dash array](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/stroke-dasharray) of the line. With
`dashOffset`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

For example：
```js

dashOffset: 5

```

itemStyle.labelLine.lineStyle.dashOffset.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the line dash offset. With
`type`
, we can make the line style more flexible.

Refer to MDN [lineDashOffset](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineDashOffset) for more details.

itemStyle.labelLine.lineStyle.cap.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To specify how to draw the end points of the line.
Possible values are:
+ `'butt'`: The ends of lines are squared off at the endpoints.
+ `'round'`: The ends of lines are rounded.
+ `'square'`: The ends of lines are squared off by adding a box with an equal width and half the height of the line's thickness.

Default value is `'butt'`. Refer to MDN [lineCap](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineCap) for more details.

itemStyle.labelLine.lineStyle.join.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To determine the shape used to join two line segments where they meet.

Possible values are:
+ `'bevel'`: Fills an additional triangular area between the common endpoint of connected segments, and the separate outside rectangular corners of each segment.
+ `'round'`: Rounds off the corners of a shape by filling an additional sector of disc centered at the common endpoint of connected segments. The radius for these rounded corners is equal to the line width.
+ `'miter'`: Connected segments are joined by extending their outside edges to connect at a single point, with the effect of filling an additional lozenge-shaped area. This setting is affected by the
`miterLimit`
property.

Default value is `'bevel'`. Refer to MDN [lineJoin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineJoin) for more details.

itemStyle.labelLine.lineStyle.miterLimit.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`





To set the miter limit ratio. Only works when
`join`
is set as `miter`.

Default value is `10`. Negative、`0`、`Infinity` and `NaN` values are ignored.

Refer to MDN [miterLimit](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/miterLimit) for more details.

itemStyle.labelLine.lineStyle.shadowBlur.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

itemStyle.labelLine.lineStyle.shadowColo.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

itemStyle.labelLine.lineStyle.shadowOffs.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.
Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

itemStyle.labelLine.lineStyle.opacity.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

itemStyle.itemStyle.desc:
旭日图扇形块的样式。

可以在 [series.itemStyle](~series-sunburst.itemStyle) 定义所有扇形块的样式，也可以在 [series.levels.itemStyle](~series-sunburst.levels.itemStyle) 定义每一层扇形块的样式，还可以在 [series.data.itemStyle](~series-sunburst.data.itemStyle) 定义每个扇形块单独的样式，这三者的优先级从低到高。也就是说，如果定义了 [series.data.itemStyle](~series-sunburst.data.itemStyle)，将会覆盖 [series.itemStyle](~series-sunburst.itemStyle) 和 [series.levels.itemStyle](~series-sunburst.levels.itemStyle)。

**优先级：[series.data.itemStyle](~series-sunburst.data.itemStyle) > [series.levels.itemStyle](~series-sunburst.levels.itemStyle) > [series.itemStyle](~series-sunburst.itemStyle)。**

itemStyle.itemStyle.color.desc:
color. Color is taken from [option.color Palette](~color) by default. Since 5.2.0, it can be set to `'inherit'` in the `emphasis` state to disable color highlight.



> Supports setting as solid color using `rgb(255,255,255)`, `rgba(255,255,255,1)`, `#fff`, etc. Also supports setting as gradient color and pattern fill, see [option.color](~color) for details

itemStyle.itemStyle.borderColor.desc: border color, whose format is similar to that of `color`.


To specify how to draw the end points of the line.

+ `'round'`: The ends of lines are rounded.

Default value is `'butt'`. Refer to MDN [lineCap](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineCap) for more details.

itemStyle.itemStyle.borderJoin.desc:

To determine the shape used to join two line segments where they meet.

Possible values are:

+ `'round'`: Rounds off the corners of a shape by filling an additional sector of disc centered at the common endpoint of connected segments. The radius for these rounded corners is equal to the line width.
+ `'miter'`: Connected segments are joined by extending their outside edges to connect at a single point, with the effect of filling an additional lozenge-shaped area. This setting is affected by the

property.

Default value is `'bevel'`. Refer to MDN [lineJoin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/CanvasRenderingContext2D/lineJoin) for more details.

To set the miter limit ratio. Only works when
